name: Masked Figures in Entertainment Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Without doubt, the most famous masked figure (at least in the U.S.) is "The Lone Ranger". Who played him on TV?
questions.explanation:
Clayton Moore.

	Moore played him for years; Silverheels played Tonto. Spillsbury played him in the movies in "The Legend of The Lone Ranger". Shayne was in the TV version of "Superman".

questions.text: Another famous masked figure is "The Man In The Iron Mask". Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Alexandre Dumas.

	Intrigue surrounds this story: it's unclear whether it's pure fiction or whether it's based on fact.

questions.text: The use of masks in the theatre was popular in ancient times, but not in modern theatre. Eugene O'Neill revived the custom in one of his plays. Which one?
questions.explanation:
The Great God Brown.

	When you're a great dramatist, you can try anything, I guess.

questions.text: Buttons the clown (played by James Stewart) always wore his make-up in "The Greatest Show On Earth" in order to avoid the police. What was his crime?
The hero of "Scaramouche" wears a mask to avoid his enemies and pursuers. Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Rafael Sabatini.

	Stewart Granger played the character in the movie. Leroux wrote "Phantom of the Opera".

questions.text: Mozart is taunted by a man wearing a mask in "Amadeus". Who (other than Mozart's father, Leopold) wore the mask?
questions.explanation:
Salieri.

	Fine play by Peter Shaffer; fine movie, too - with great performances by F. Murray Abraham (Salieri) and Tom Hulce (Mozart).

questions.text: The protagonist in one of Hitchcock's movies wears a costume (complete with mask) at a costume ball in order to evade the police and further his own purpose. Who played this character?
questions.explanation:
Cary Grant.

	Grant appears as a costumed figure who accompanies Grace Kelly to the ball in "To Catch a Thief". Vintage Hitchcock.

questions.text: Zorro was another legendary masked figure from TV. Who played him?
questions.explanation:
Guy Williams.

	Jones played Jesse James in the TV series of the same name. O'Brian played Wyatt Earp in the TV series of the same name. Gulager played Billy the Kid in the TV series "Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid. (Barry Sullivan played Pat Garrett.)

questions.text: Zorro also had a movie career, most notably in the classic movie "The Mark of Zorro". Who played Zorro?
questions.explanation:
Tyrone Power.

	Cute tongue-in-cheek swashbuckler with Power and Linda Darnell.

questions.text: Claude Rains starred in "the Phantom of the Opera" as a man who wore a mask. Why did he wear it?
options: To hide in disgrace for his failures
questions.explanation:
To hide his disfigured face.

	Fine actor with a long career. The face was disfigured, and so...
